description.compact: Class to access a clients resources from the create send API.

docblock.description: This class includes functions to create and edit clients, along with accessing lists of client specific resources e.g campaigns

description.compact: The base route of the clients resource.

param.description: The client id to access (Ignored for create requests)
Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

description.compact: Change the client id used for calls after construction
Gets a list of sent campaigns for the current client

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: array( { 'WebVersionURL' => The web version url of the campaign 'WebVersionTextURL' => The web version url of the text version of the campaign 'CampaignID' => The id of the campaign 'Subject' => The campaign subject 'Name' => The name of the campaign 'FromName' => The from name for the campaign 'FromEmail' => The from email address for the campaign 'ReplyTo' => The reply to email address for the campaign 'SentDate' => The sent data of the campaign 'TotalRecipients' => The number of recipients of the campaign } )

description.compact: Gets a list of scheduled campaigns for the current client

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: array( { 'CampaignID' => The id of the campaign 'Name' => The name of the campaign 'Subject' => The subject of the campaign 'FromName' => The from name for the campaign 'FromEmail' => The from email address for the campaign 'ReplyTo' => The reply to email address for the campaign 'DateCreated' => The date the campaign was created 'PreviewURL' => The preview url of the campaign 'PreviewTextURL' => The preview url of the text version of the campaign 'DateScheduled' => The date the campaign is scheduled to be sent 'ScheduledTimeZone' => The time zone in which the campaign is scheduled to be sent at 'DateScheduled' } )

description.compact: Gets a list of draft campaigns for the current client

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: array( { 'CampaignID' => The id of the campaign 'Name' => The name of the campaign 'Subject' => The subject of the campaign 'FromName' => The from name for the campaign 'FromEmail' => The from email address for the campaign 'ReplyTo' => The reply to email address for the campaign 'DateCreated' => The date the campaign was created 'PreviewURL' => The preview url of the draft campaign 'PreviewTextURL' => The preview url of the text version of the campaign } )

description.compact: Gets all subscriber lists the current client has created

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets the lists across a client to which a subscriber with a particular email address belongs.

param.description: Subscriber's email address.

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all list segments the current client has created

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all email addresses on the current client's suppression list

param.description: The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Adds email addresses to a client's suppression list.

param.description: The email addresses to suppress.

description.compact: Unsuppresses an email address by removing it from the the client's suppression list.

param.description: The email address to be unsuppressed

description.compact: Gets all templates the current client has access to

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all templates the current client has access to

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'ApiKey' => The clients API Key, THIS IS NOT THE CLIENT ID 'BasicDetails' => { 'ClientID' => The id of the client 'CompanyName' => The company name of the client 'ContactName' => The contact name of the client 'EmailAddress' => The clients contact email address 'Country' => The clients country 'TimeZone' => The clients timezone } 'BillingDetails' => If on monthly billing { 'CurrentTier' => The current monthly tier the client sits in 'CurrentMonthlyRate' => The current pricing rate the client pays per month 'MarkupPercentage' => The percentage markup applied to the base rates 'Currency' => The currency paid in 'ClientPays' => Whether the client pays for themselves, 'MonthlyScheme' => Basic or Unlimited } If paying per campaign { 'CanPurchaseCredits' => Whether the client can purchase credits 'Credits' => The number of credits belonging to the client 'BaseDeliveryFee' => The base fee payable per campaign 'BaseRatePerRecipient' => The base fee payable per campaign recipient 'BaseDesignSpamTestRate' => The base fee payable per design and spam test 'MarkupOnDelivery' => The markup applied per campaign 'MarkupPerRecipient' => The markup applied per campaign recipient 'MarkupOnDesignSpamTest' => The markup applied per design and spam test 'Currency' => The currency fees are paid in 'ClientPays' => Whether client client pays for themselves } }

description.compact: Deletes an existing client from the system

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Creates a new client based on the provided information

param.description: Basic information of the new client.

docblock.param: This should be an array of the form array( 'CompanyName' => The company name of the client 'Country' => The clients country 'TimeZone' => The clients timezone )

return.description: A successful response will be the ID of the newly created client

description.compact: Updates the basic information for a client

param.description: Basic information of the client.

docblock.param: This should be an array of the form array( 'CompanyName' => The company name of the client 'Country' => The clients country 'TimeZone' => The clients timezone )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Updates the billing details of the current client, setting the client to the payg billing model For clients not set to pay themselves then all fields below ClientPays are ignored All Markup fields are optional

param.description: Payg billing details of the client.

docblock.param: This should be an array of the form array( 'Currency' => The currency fees are paid in 'ClientPays' => Whether client client pays for themselves 'MarkupPercentage' => Can be used to set the percentage markup for all unset fees 'CanPurchaseCredits' => Whether the client can purchase credits 'MarkupOnDelivery' => The markup applied per campaign 'MarkupPerRecipient' => The markup applied per campaign recipient 'MarkupOnDesignSpamTest' => The markup applied per design and spam test )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Updates the billing details of the current client, setting the client to the monthly billing model For clients not set to pay themselves then the markup percentage field is ignored

param.description: Payg billing details of the client.

docblock.param: This should be an array of the form array( 'Currency' => The currency fees are paid in 'ClientPays' => Whether client client pays for themselves 'MarkupPercentage' => Sets the percentage markup used for all monthly tiers )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Transfer credits to or from this client.

param.description: Details for the credit transfer. This array

docblock.param: should be of the form: array( 'Credits' => An in representing the number of credits to transfer. This value may be either positive if you want to allocate credits from your account to the client, or negative if you want to deduct credits from the client back into your account. 'CanUseMyCreditsWhenTheyRunOut' => A boolean value which if set to true, will allow the client to continue sending using your credits or payment details once they run out of credits, and if set to false, will prevent the client from using your credits to continue sending until you allocate more credits to them. )

return.description: A successful response will be an object

description.compact: returns the people associated with this client.

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: retrieves the email address of the primary contact for this client

return.description: a successful response will be an array in the form:

docblock.return: array('EmailAddress'=> email address of primary contact)

description.compact: assigns the primary contact for this client to the person with the specified email address

param.description: the email address of the person designated to be the primary contact

return.description: a successful response will be an array in the form:

docblock.return: array('EmailAddress'=> email address of primary contact)

description.compact: The protocol to use while accessing the api
The base route of the create send api.
The serialiser to use for serialisation and deserialisation of API request and response data
The transport to use to send API requests

var.description: or CS_REST_SocketTransport or your own custom transport.

description.compact: The logger to use for debugging of all API requests
The default options to use for each API request.

docblock.description:
These can be overridden by passing in an array as the call_options argument to a single api request. Valid options are:
deserialise boolean: Set this to false if you want to get the raw response. This can be useful if your passing json directly to javascript.
While there are clearly other options there is no need to change them.

param.description: Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')
Note that this method will continue to work in the deprecated case when $auth_details is passed in as a string containing an API key.

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

comment.value: If $auth_details is a string, assume it is an API key

description.compact: Refresh the current OAuth token using the current refresh token.

return.description: True if the wrapper is using SSL.

description.compact: Internal method to make a general API request based on the provided options
